revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Kristen Wiig | image = Kristen Wiig TIFF 2014.jpg | caption = Wiig at the [[2014 Toronto International Film Festival]] | birthname = Kristen Carroll Wiig | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1973|8|22}} | birth_place = [[Canandaigua (city), New York|Canandaigua, New York]], U.S. | alma_mater = [[University of Arizona]] | occupation = {{flat list| *Actress *comedian *writer *producer }} | years_active = 2003–present | spouse = {{marriage|Hayes Hargrove
|2005|2009|end=divorced}} | module = {{Infobox comedian|embed=yes | medium = Television, film | genre = [[Satire]]/[[political satire]]/[[news satire]], [[improvisational comedy]], [[sketch comedy]] | subject = [[American politics]], [[American culture]], [[current events]], [[popular culture|pop culture]], [[mass media]]/[[news media]] | notable_work = ''[[Saturday Night Live]]''
''[[Bridesmaids (2011 film)|Bridesmaids]]''
''[[The Martian (film)|The Martian]]''
''[[Ghostbusters (2016 film)|Ghostbusters]]''
''[[Despicable Me (franchise)|Despicable Me]]'' (franchise)
''[[How to Train Your Dragon (franchise)|How to Train Your Dragon]]'' (franchise) | influences = | influenced = }} | website = {{URL|kristenwiig.com}} }} '''Kristen Carroll Wiig''' ({{IPAc-en|w|ɪ|ɡ}}; born August 22, 1973){{cite news|title=Monitor|newspaper=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=August 17, 2012|issue=issue 1220/1221|page=28}} is an American actress, comedian, writer, and producer. She is known for her work on the [[NBC]] sketch comedy series ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' (2005–12), and such films as ''[[Bridesmaids (2011 film)|Bridesmaids]]'', [[The Martian (film)|''The Martian'']], and ''[[Ghostbusters (2016 film)|Ghostbusters]]''. Wiig was born in [[Canandaigua, New York]], and raised in [[Lancaster, Pennsylvania]], and [[Rochester, New York]]. Wiig attended the [[University of Arizona]], where she majored in fine art. She later relocated to [[Los Angeles]], where she broke into comedy as a member of the improvisational comedy troupe [[The Groundlings]] and made her television debut in 2003. Wiig joined the cast of ''Saturday Night Live'' in 2005, and the following year, she co-starred in the Christmas comedy film ''[[Unaccompanied Minors]]''.{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/television/news/2005-12-01-snl-new-cast_x.htm?POE=LIFISVA|title=They're live on 'SNL'|date=December 1, 2005|accessdate=January 12, 2017|work=[[USA Today]]}} After appearing in a series of supporting roles in comedy films such as ''[[Adventureland (film)|Adventureland]]'', ''[[Whip It (film)|Whip It]]'', and ''[[Paul (film)|Paul]]'', she starred in and co-wrote the screenplay for ''Bridesmaids'', which was both critically and commercially successful. Wiig has received eight [[Emmy Award]] nominations and has been nominated for an [[Annie Award for Voice Acting in a Feature Production]] for her work on ''[[Despicable Me 2]]''. In 2012, ''Bridesmaids'' earned her a [[Golden Globe Award]] nomination for [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actress – Motion Picture Musical or Comedy|Best Actress – Musical or Comedy]], as well as nominations for the [[Academy Award]] and [[BAFTA]] for Best Original Screenplay and a [[SAG Award]] nomination for [[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture|Outstanding Performance by a Cast]].{{IMDb name|id=1325419|name=Kristen Wiig|section=awards}} She was also nominated for a [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Miniseries or a Movie]] for her role as Cynthia Morehouse in the miniseries ''[[The Spoils of Babylon]]''. In 2019, she will play the villain [[Cheetah (comics)|Cheetah]] in the [[Wonder Woman 1984|sequel]] to ''[[Wonder Woman (2017 film)|Wonder Woman]]'' in the [[DC Extended Universe]]. ==Early life== Wiig was born August 22, 1973, in [[Canandaigua, New York]],[http://www.biography.com/people/kristen-wiig-586136 "Kristen Wiig Biography"]. bio. Retrieved January 1, 2017. the daughter of Jon Wiig, who ran a lake marina in [[Western New York]], and Laurie (Johnston), an artist.[https://www.theguardian.com/film/2011/nov/18/kristen-wiig-bridesmaids?newsfeed=true "Kristen Wiig: 'My next movie – it's going to be a Porky's prequel' "] November 18, 2011, The GuardianMargaret (Johnston) Harris Obituary at MPNow.com, August 6, 2010 Her father has Norwegian and Irish ancestry and her mother is of English and Scottish descent.[http://www.independent.ie/entertainment/film-cinema/always-the-bridesmaid-2677666.html Always the bridesmaid – Film & Cinema, Entertainment]. ''The Independent''. (Ireland) Retrieved on August 7, 2011. The name Wiig comes from the area [[Vik]] in [[Sogn og Fjordane]] in Norway.[http://www.filmmagasinet.no/no/Intervjuer/Komi-Kristen/ "Komi-Kristen"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110625225322/http://www.filmmagasinet.no/no/Intervjuer/Komi-Kristen/ |date=June 25, 2011 }} (in Norwegian), Film Magasinet Wiig moved with her family to [[Lancaster, Pennsylvania]], at the age of three, and attended Nitrauer Elementary School and Manheim Township Middle School until eighth grade.{{cite news|first=Don |last=Botch |title=Kristen Wiig among the stars of 'Ghostbusters' reboot |url=http://www.readingeagle.com/life/article/kristen-wiig-among-the-stars-of-ghostbusters-reboot |work=[[Reading Eagle]] |date=July 17, 2016 |accessdate=July 16, 2016}} She then moved to [[Rochester, New York]], with her family at the age of 13, where she attended the prestigious [[Allendale Columbia School]] for ninth and tenth grades[http://ohnotheydidnt.livejournal.com/19279415.html 'Radar interviews SNL's Kristen Wiig']. Retrieved on February 10, 2015. and graduated from [[Brighton High School (Rochester, New York)|Brighton High School]].{{citation needed|date=January 2017}} She left for her first try at college, and not finding what she wanted, returned to Rochester. She attended community college and did a three-month outdoor-living program. She had no performing ambitions at this time.{{Cite web|title=Kristin Wiig/Alec Baldwin Interview Transcript |url=http://www.wnyc.org/deprecated/story/197391-kristen-wiig/transcript/ |website=WNYC, "Here's the Thing." |date=April 9, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150913232449/http://www.wnyc.org/deprecated/story/197391-kristen-wiig/transcript/ |archivedate=September 13, 2015 |df= }} Wiig attended the [[University of Arizona]], majoring in art. When she took an acting class in college to fulfill a course requirement, the teacher suggested she continue to act.{{cite news |url= https://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/01/magazine/mag-01wiig-t.html |title= Can Kristen Wiig Turn on the Charm?|first= Susan|last= Dominus|work=The New York Times |date= April 28, 2011 |location=New York City |issn=0362-4331 |accessdate=April 29, 2011}} She expected to start out a job at a plastic surgery clinic drawing pictures of people's postsurgery bodies, but decided to move to Los Angeles and act.{{cite web|url=http://www.biography.com/people/kristen-wiig-586136#early-life |title=Kristen Wiig |publisher=Biography.com |date= |accessdate=November 8, 2016}} ==Career== === Early career === Wiig relocated to Los Angeles to act while working odd jobs to support herself. She performed with Empty Stage Comedy Theatre{{cite press release|publisher=SpikeTV|date = August 12, 2003|title = How Real Is Reality Programming? SPIKE TV'S 'The Joe Schmo Show' Puts New Twist on Reality Show Genre, Where Only One Contestant Is Real|url = http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/how-real-is-reality-programming-70924162.html|accessdate=April 29, 2011}} and with [[The Groundlings]].{{cite news|last=Itzkoff|first=Dave|title=Extended Interview with Kristen Wiig|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/08/25/arts/television/extended-interview-with-kristen-wiig.html?_r=0|publisher=NYTimes|accessdate=August 22, 2013|date=August 22, 2013}} She felt improvisation was a better fit than acting, and being a part of the comedy group improved her skills.{{cite web|url=http://www.boomsbeat.com/articles/4813/20140603/50-interesting-facts-about-kristen-wiig-is-a-naturally-shy-person-her-favorite-people-to-make-laugh-are-babies.htm|title=50 interesting facts about Kristen Wiig: is a naturally shy person, her favorite people to make laugh are babies|work=BOOMSbeat}} In 2003, she appeared in [[Spike TV]]'s ''[[The Joe Schmo Show]]'', a spoof of reality television, in which she played Dr. Pat, a quack marriage counselor. While at The Groundlings, Wiig's manager encouraged her to submit an audition tape to ''Saturday Night Live''. Wiig played the [[Recurring Saturday Night Live characters and sketches introduced 2005–2006#Target Lady|Target Lady]] on part of her audition tape."The Volvo-ness". [[Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee]]. Season 9. Episode 1. January 5, 2017. [[Netflix]]. ===Television=== Wiig debuted on ''SNL'' shortly into [[Saturday Night Live (season 31)|season 31]], on November 12, 2005. She survived an ''SNL'' budget cut,{{cite web|url=http://www.villagevoice.com/2006-10-24/nyc-life/that-70s-show/|title=That '70s Show|publisher=Village Voice|first=Rachel|last=Sklar|date=October 24, 2006}} becoming a full member of the repertory cast at the beginning of [[Saturday Night Live (season 32)|season 32]] in 2006 and until 2012. Wiig was nominated for a [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series]]{{cite web|url=http://www.emmys.com/celebrities/kristen-wiig|title=Kristen Wiig|work=Television Academy}} for her work on ''Saturday Night Live'' (2009,Bierly, Mandi. (July 15, 2009) [http://popwatch.ew.com/2009/07/15/emmy-awards-the-2009-nominees/?ew_packageID=20300978#comedyactress Emmy Awards: the 2009 nominees | EW.com]. Popwatch.ew.com. Retrieved on August 7, 2011. 2010, 2011, 2012).{{cite web |url= http://ca.eonline.com/uberblog/b189226_emmys_2010_comedy_acting_matthew.html |title=Emmys 2010 Comedy Acting: Matthew Morrison Leads Glee Choir|first= Joal|last= Ryan|work=ca.eonline.com |date= July 8, 2010|accessdate=April 29, 2011}} In December 2009, she headlined in the Christmas special ''SNL Presents: A Very Gilly Christmas'', which featured new sketches with her character [[Recurring Saturday Night Live characters and sketches introduced 2008–2009#Gilly|Gilly]] and highlights of older ''SNL'' clips. Wiig was featured in ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'''s list of 15 Great Performances for her various impersonations on ''Saturday Night Live''[http://www.ew.com/ew/gallery/0,,20162677_20164091_20248814_18,00.html "15 Great Performances In 2008"] ''Entertainment Weekly'', Photo 19 of 20, (December 2008) and in ''EW'''s list of the 25 Funniest Women in Hollywood (April 2009).[http://www.ew.com/ew/gallery/0,,20271251_5,00.html "The 25 Funniest Actresses in Hollywood"]. ''Entertainment Weekly'' Photo 6 of 26 As of 2011, she voiced [[Lola Bunny]] in the series ''[[The Looney Tunes Show]]''. Her final performance as a cast member on ''Saturday Night Live'' was season 37, episode 22, which aired on May 19, 2012.{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/people/story/2012-05-20/kristen-Wiig-sendoff-snl/55087064/1|title=Kristen Wiig gets an emotional send-off from 'SNL'|work=USATODAY.COM|date=May 20, 2012}} The show was hosted by [[Mick Jagger]]. The closing celebration of her time on the show included ''SNL'' alumni [[Amy Poehler]], [[Chris Kattan]], [[Chris Parnell]], [[Will Forte]], and [[Rachel Dratch]], as well as [[Steve Martin]] and [[Jon Hamm]]. She returned to host the program on May 11, 2013.{{cite news|last=Luippold|first=Ross|title=Kristen Wiig To Host 'SNL' May 11 With Vampire Weekend|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/04/26/kristen-wiig-to-host-snl-may-11-vampire-weekend_n_3163993.html|work=The Huffington Post|accessdate=April 26, 2013|date=April 26, 2013}} On February 19, 2014, Wiig appeared on the second episode of fellow ''SNL'' alumnus [[Jimmy Fallon]]'s run on ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon|The Tonight Show]]'' from [[30 Rockefeller Plaza]] in New York City. In what appeared to be an unscripted spoof, she played the role of ideal boy band [[One Direction]] member [[Harry Styles]].{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2562685/Kristin-Wiig-does-hilarious-Harry-Styles-impression-fellow-SNL-alumnus-Jimmy-Fallons-Tonight-Show.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title=It's Tuesday night live! Kristen Wiig does hilarious Harry Styles impression on fellow SNL alumnus' Jimmy Fallon's Tonight Show}} She returned to host''SNL'' again on November 19, 2016. For singer-songwriter [[Sia Furler|Sia]]'s performance of her 2014 single "[[Chandelier (song)|Chandelier]]" at the [[57th Annual Grammy Awards|2015 Grammy Awards]], Wiig danced alongside child dancer [[Maddie Ziegler]].{{cite news|last=Swift|first=Andy|title=Sia Enlists Kristen Wiig for 'Chandelier' Performance at 2015 Grammy Awards|url=http://tvline.com/2015/02/08/sia-kristen-wiig-grammy-performance-2015-grammys-chandelier/|publisher=tvline.com|accessdate=February 8, 2015|date=February 8, 2015}} In January 2018, it was announced that Wiig would be starring and executive producing, along side [[Reese Witherspoon]] and Lauren Neustadter, in a new untitled 30 minute comedy series from [[Apple Inc.|Apple]] and production company, Hello Sunshine.{{Cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2018/01/17/entertainment/kristen-wiig-apple-series-reese-witherspoon/index.html|title=Kristen Wiig to star in comedy series from Apple|last=CNN|first=Sandra Gonzalez,|work=CNN|access-date=2018-01-18}} ===Podcast=== [[Gimlet Media]]'s{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt8280912/|title=Sandra|author=|date=|publisher=|accessdate=May 6, 2018|via=www.imdb.com}} scripted fiction podcast series ''[[Gimlet Media#Sandra|Sandra]]'' stars Kristen Wiig and [[Alia Shawkat]].{{cite web|url=http://nymag.com/selectall/smarthome/gimlet-sandra-kristen-wiig-alia-shawkat-alexa-voice-assistant-ai.html|title=Gimlet’s New Show Is About the Human Side of AI|first=Charley|last=Locke|date=|website=nymag.com|accessdate=May 6, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2018/may/04/sandra-gimlets-siri-drama-starring-alia-shawkat-podcasts-of-the-week|title=Sandra: Gimlet's siri drama starring Alia Shawkat - podcasts of the week|first=Rowan|last=Slaney|date=May 4, 2018|website=the Guardian|accessdate=May 6, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.cnet.com/news/alexa-meet-sandra-kristen-wiig-stars-in-new-podcast-drama-ethan-hawke-gimlet-media/|title=When Alexa met Sandra: Kristen Wiig stars in new podcast|author=|date=April 18, 2018|website=cnet.com|accessdate=May 6, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2018/digital/news/gimlet-kristen-wiig-alia-shawkat-podcast-startup-season-7-1202748451/|title=Gimlet Announces Scripted Podcast Starring Kristen Wiig and Alia Shawkat, Renews ‘StartUp’ for Season 7|first=Todd|last=Spangler|date=April 11, 2018|website=variety.com|accessdate=May 6, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/kristen-wiig-alia-shawkat-starring-gimlet-media-scripted-podcast-1101257|title=Gimlet Media Sets Scripted Podcast Starring Kristen Wiig, Alia Shawkat|author=|date=|website=hollywoodreporter.com|accessdate=May 6, 2018}} All episodes{{cite web|url=https://www.listennotes.com/c/48cadffd3b264ca7bb88f2eb5fd64a65/sandra/|title=Sandra|author=|date=|website=listennotes.com|accessdate=May 6, 2018}} premiered 18 April 2018.{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2018/04/gimlet-media-spring-slate-scripted-series-kristen-wiig-alia-shawkat-1202361779/|title=Gimlet Media’s Spring Slate Includes Scripted Series Toplined By Kristen Wiig & Alia Shawkat|first=Denise|last=Petski|date=April 11, 2018|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|accessdate=May 6, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://feeds.gimletmedia.com/sandrashow|title=Sandra|author=|date=|website=feeds.gimletmedia.com|accessdate=May 6, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.gimletmedia.com/sandra/all|title=Sandra - All Episodes|author=|date=|website=Gimlet Media|accessdate=May 6, 2018}} ===Film=== Wiig made her film debut in the 2006 [[Christmas]] movie ''[[Unaccompanied Minors]].'' The following year, she appeared in [[Judd Apatow]]'s comedy ''[[Knocked Up]]'' as a [[passive-aggressive]] assistant, and performed in [[Jake Kasdan]]'s ''[[Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story|Walk Hard]]'', another Apatow-produced film. In 2008, she had small roles in several films, including ''[[Forgetting Sarah Marshall]]'' and [[David Koepp]]'s ''[[Ghost Town (2008 film)|Ghost Town]]''. In 2009, Wiig had supporting roles in [[Greg Mottola]]'s ''[[Adventureland (film)|Adventureland]]'', [[Mike Judge]]'s ''[[Extract (film)|Extract]]'', and ''[[Whip It (film)|Whip It]]'', [[Drew Barrymore]]'s directorial debut. From 2010-2011, she appeared in the films ''[[MacGruber (film)|MacGruber]]'', the animated comedies ''[[Despicable Me]]'' and ''[[How to Train Your Dragon (film)|How to Train Your Dragon]]'', [[Andrew Jarecki]]'s ''[[All Good Things (film)|All Good Things]]'' and [[Greg Mottola]]'s comedy ''[[Paul (film)|Paul]]''. Later in 2011, she starred in the film ''[[Bridesmaids (2011 film)|Bridesmaids]]'', which she co-wrote with fellow Groundlings performer [[Annie Mumolo]]. [[Universal Studios|Universal Pictures]] released the film on May 13, 2011{{cite web |url=http://www.screendaily.com/news/us-americas/mandate-pictures-heads-for-the-highway-with-female-road-movie/5003734.article |title=Mandate Pictures heads for the highway with female road movie |publisher=[[Screen Daily]] |author=Jeremy Kay |date=July 21, 2009 |accessdate=July 25, 2009}} and it became both a critical and box-office success. It was nominated for [[Golden Globe Award for Best Motion Picture – Musical or Comedy|Best Picture-Musical or Comedy]] and Wiig was nominated for [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actress – Motion Picture Comedy or Musical|Best Actress-Motion Picture, Musical or Comedy]] at the [[69th Golden Globe Awards]]. The film also received two [[Academy Awards|Academy Award]] nominations: Wiig and Mumolo for [[Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay|Best Original Screenplay]] and co-star, [[Melissa McCarthy]], for [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress|Best Supporting Actress]]. The film grossed over $280 million worldwide.[http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=wiigapatow.htm Bridesmaids] at Box Office Mojo In 2014, Wiig starred with ''Saturday Night Live'' alumnus [[Bill Hader]] in ''[[The Skeleton Twins]]''. In 2015, she starred in ''[[Nasty Baby]]'', as Polly, a family practitioner who is more interested in having a baby than having a boyfriend. The film was directed by Chilean filmmaker Sebastián Silva.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.indiewire.com/theplaylist/first-look-kristen-wiig-in-sebastian-silvas-nasty-baby-20140905|title=First Look: Kristen Wiig In Sebastian Silva's 'Nasty Baby - The Playlist|author=Zach Hollwedel|date=September 5, 2014|work=The Playlist}} Wiig also starred in ''[[Welcome to Me]]'', a comedy-drama directed by [[Shira Piven]] which premiered at the [[2014 Toronto International Film Festival]]. In 2014, news outlets reported that Wiig and Mumolo were writing a new comedy, making the film Wiig's debut as a director.{{Cite web|title = 'Bridesmaids' Team Kristen Wiig And Annie Mumolo Set Comedy At TriStar|url = http://deadline.com/2014/06/bridesmaids-team-kristen-wiig-and-annie-mumolo-set-comedy-at-tristar-787452/|website = Deadline|accessdate = October 30, 2015|language = en}} The name of the film and release date are yet to be confirmed.{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/moviesnow/la-et-mn-kristen-wiig-to-direct-first-film-written-with-bridesmaids-partner-20140611-story.html |title=Kristen Wiig to direct first film, written with 'Bridesmaids' partner |publisher=LA Times |date=June 11, 2014 |accessdate=August 26, 2014}} In 2016, Wiig played one of the leading roles in the reboot ''[[Ghostbusters (2016 film)|Ghostbusters]]'' alongside Melissa McCarthy, [[Leslie Jones (comedian)|Leslie Jones]], and [[Kate McKinnon]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/87423/female-ghostbusters-revealed/ |title= Female Ghostbusters Revealed |publisher=Dread Central |date=October 20, 2014 |first=Nellie |last=Andreeva |accessdate=October 21, 2014 }}. In the autumn of 2016, she appeared in video as an onstage "stand-in" during the [[Nostalgic for the Present Tour|Nostalgia For the Present]] concert tour of Australian singer Sia Furler for her song, "One Million Bullets".{{cite web|last1=Stevenson|first1=Jane|title=Crowd eats up pop star Sia's minimalistic show|url=http://www.torontosun.com/2016/10/23/crowd-eats-up-pop-star-sias-minimalistic-show|website=Torontosun.com|accessdate=November 6, 2016}} In 2017, Wiig appeared in the films ''[[Mother!]]'', directed by [[Darren Aronofsky]],{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2017/03/kristie-wiig-richard-linklater-drama-movie-whered-you-go-bernadette-1202049738/|title=Kristen Wiig In Negotiations To Star In ‘Where’d You Go Bernadette?’|website=Deadline Hollywood|first=Anita|last=Busch|date=March 23, 2017|accessdate=March 26, 2017}} and ''[[Downsizing (film)|Downsizing]]'' starring [[Matt Damon]], directed by [[Alexander Payne]].{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/kristen-wiig-replacing-reese-witherspoon-879158|title=Kristen Wiig Replacing Reese Witherspoon in Alexander Payne's 'Downsizing'|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|first=Rebecca|last=Ford|date=March 26, 2016|accessdate=July 10, 2017}} In February 2017, ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' reported that Wiig will star in an English-language remake of ''[[Toni Erdmann]]'', opposite [[Jack Nicholson]].{{cite web|last1=Kroll|first1=Justin|title=Jack Nicholson, Kristen Wiig to Star in ‘Toni Erdmann’ Remake (EXCLUSIVE)|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/jack-nicholson-toni-erdmann-remake-retirement-oscar-nominated-1201980617/|website=Variety|publisher=Penske Business Media, LLC|accessdate=February 8, 2017}} In March 2018, it was announced that Wiig would be starring in the next Wonder Woman film, as the villain [[the Cheetah]] {{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/comic-riffs/wp/2018/03/09/kristen-wiig-will-star-in-wonder-woman-sequel-as-the-cheetah-patty-jenkins-confirms/|title=Kristen Wiig will star in 'Wonder Woman' sequel as the Cheetah, Patty Jenkins confirms|date=March 9, 2018|first=David|last=Betancourt|work=The Washington Post}} ==Personal life== Wiig was married to actor Hayes Hargrove from 2005 to 2009.{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/01/04/arts/television/04ryzi.html?pagewanted=2 |work=The New York Times |title=She's Really Shy, but That's a Secret |first=Melena |last=Ryzik |date=January 4, 2009 |accessdate=April 3, 2010}}{{cite news|url=http://blog.sfgate.com/dailydish/2011/06/13/kristen-wiig-rules-out-second-marriage/|title=Kristen Wiig Rules Out Second Marriage|publisher=San Francisco Chronicle|date=June 13, 2011|accessdate=January 8, 2012|work=The San Francisco Chronicle}} Wiig endorsed presidential candidate [[Bernie Sanders]] in 2016.{{cite news |title=Kristen Wiig, Mark Ruffalo, Miley Cyrus, and More Endorse Bernie in Video |url=http://flavorwire.com/570946/kristen-wiig-mark-ruffalo-miley-cyrus-and-more-endorse-bernie-in-video |date=April 11, 2016 |accessdate=July 11, 2017}}http://flavorwire.com/570946/kristen-wiig-mark-ruffalo-miley-cyrus-and-more-endorse-bernie-in-videohttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x4u4am5J4FU ==Filmography== Dragon (film)|How to Train Your Dragon]]''|| Ruffnut Thorston (voice) || |- | 2010 || ''[[Date Night]]'' || Haley Sullivan || |- | 2010 || ''[[MacGruber (film)|MacGruber]]'' || Vicki St. Elmo || |- | 2010 || ''[[Despicable Me]]'' || Miss Hattie (voice) || |- | 2010 || ''[[All Good Things (film)|All Good Things]]'' || Lauren Fleck || |- | 2011 || ''[[Paul (film)|Paul]]'' || Ruth Buggs || |- | 2011 || ''[[Bridesmaids (2011 film)|Bridesmaids]]'' || Annie Walker || Also writer |- | 2011 || ''[[Friends with Kids]]'' || Missy || |- | 2012 || ''[[Revenge for Jolly!]]'' || Angela || |- | 2012 ||
